text: (Thomas) Brian Macdonald, OBE was an Anglican bishop in the second half of the 20th Century. Macdonald trained for the priesthood at St Aidan's Theological College, Ballarat and was ordained in 1935. After curacies in Warracknabeal and Ballarat he was Priest in charge at Landsborough.Crockford's Clerical Directory 1980-82, p. 636. London: Oxford University Press, 1983 He held incumbencies at Manjimup and Claremont. During World War Two he was a Chaplain in the AIF. He was Chaplain of St Peter's College, Adelaide from 1950 to 1959; Dean of Perth from 1959 to 1961;SLWA Archdeacon of Perth from 1961 to 1967; and Assistant Bishop of Perth from 1964 to 1979. ==References== Category:Alumni of St Aidan's Theological College, Ballarat Category:20th- century Anglican priests Category:Archdeacons of Perth, WA Category:Deans of Perth Category:Assistant bishops in the Anglican Diocese of Perth Category:Officers of the Order of the British Empire Category:Australian Army chaplains
